intro: Brassica narinosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mustard, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The plant is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of mustard oil.
